verses.roman:
śaṅkhaṁ dadhmau vinirgatya
harir dāruka-sārathiḥ
tato 'bhūt para-sainyānāṁ
hṛdi vitrāsa-vepathuḥ

synonyms: śaṅkham—His conchshell; dadhmau—blew; vinirgatya—upon going out; hariḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; dāruka-sārathiḥ—whose chariot driver was Dāruka; tataḥ—thereupon; abhūt—arose; para—of the enemy; sainyānām—among the soldiers; hṛdi—in their hearts; vitrāsa—in terror; vepathuḥ—trembling.
translation: As Lord Kṛṣṇa came out of the city with Dāruka at the reins of His chariot, He blew His conchshell, and the enemy soldiers' hearts began to tremble with fear.
